page.title: 01Bullington & surronding area
page.content: The area is predominantly used for farming. The land is gently sloping chald downland with occasional clay caps on hills. A mixed farming system is followed over the whole area and a common rotation would be 1-2 years wheat, 3-4 years barley, 3-4 years grassland. Sheep are grazed intensively to restore fertility to the shallow chalk soils. Two farms in the area have dairying as part of their mixed system. Woodlands are generally small plantations of firs and beech. There is a large natural deciduous woodland which follows the river. The river is the Dever a tributary to the river Test, this starts from Chalk Spring and is good for trout fishing.
